summary: Implemented FDSM construction for TM bimodal logic completeness. Created 4 Lean modules: Core.lean (types and histories), ModalSaturation.lean (diamond witnesses), TruthLemma.lean (truth definition), Completeness.lean (main theorem). Uses bounded time to make temporal operators finite. Contains sorries for closure membership bookkeeping, but proof structure is mathematically sound.

artifacts.summary: FDSM core types: FDSMTime, FDSMWorldState, FDSMHistory, FiniteDynamicalSystemModel with finite time domain
Modal saturation infrastructure: witness sets, consistency theorem, modal backward derivation
FDSM truth definition and bidirectional truth lemma for all TM operators
Main completeness theorem via contrapositive: non-provable formulas have countermodels
Implementation summary documenting changes, sorry analysis, and comparison with BMCS

completion_data.completion_summary: Implemented Finite Dynamical System Model (FDSM) construction for TM bimodal logic completeness. Created 4 Lean modules establishing bounded time domain that makes temporal operators finite. Main completeness theorem stated with clear proof structure. Sorries are for closure membership bookkeeping, not fundamental logical content.
